intro: Callostylis carnosissima, commonly known as the fleshy callostylis, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from red to orange, and attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Callostylis carnosissima is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens where it thrives in full sun.
